1.text: Clean the broccoli and cut it into bite-size pieces.

2.text: Put the broccoli in a microwave-safe bowl and add water.

3.text: Cover the bowl tightly to trap in the steam.

4.text: Microwave on high for 2.5 minutes, then check the broccoli every 30 seconds.

5.text: Season the broccoli as desired and serve it immediately.

6.text: Wash, dry, and chop up a 1 lb (450 g) head of broccoli.

7.text: Add 3  fl oz (89 ml) of water to a medium saucepan.

8.text: Add the broccoli to the saucepan once the water comes to a boil.

9.text: Cover the saucepan and keep it over high heat for 3 minutes.

10.text: Reduce the heat to low and steam the broccoli for 3 more minutes.

11.text: Add butter or seasonings, if desired, and serve the broccoli immediately.

12.text: Rinse and cut up a head of broccoli.

13.text: Pick out a stock pot, lid, and metal colander that suit your needs.

14.text: Add 1–2 in (2.5–5.1 cm) of water to the stock pot.

15.text: Bring the water to a boil over high heat.

16.text: Put the colander of broccoli in the stock pot and add the lid.

17.text: Reduce the heat to medium-low and check the broccoli after 5 minutes.

18.text: Season your broccoli to taste and serve it right away.
